text: - Hi, I'm Mandy, a software engineer here
in the office of Cupertino, California.

Today, I'm going to show you
how to monitor DLM policies.
If you haven't heard of DLM

or Data Lifecycle Manager
before, it's a service

to help you automate
snapshot and AMI management.

Let's look at how to
monitor DLM policy actions
with the CloudWatch Metrics.
There are two ways to interact
with these metrics through the console.
The first way is through the EC2 console.

In EC2 console navigate
to Life Cycle Manager.
You'll be able to select a policy

and then view the metrics
graphs, enter the Monitoring tab.

The second way is through the
Amazon CloudWatch console.
Go to the CloudWatch console.

Select all metrics, EBS, Data
Lifecycle Manager Metrics.

You'll be able to see exactly
how many EBS snapshots
and EBS backed AMIs created, deleted,

copied, and shared by
each policy over time.

You can monitor any failures
in resource creation,
as well as set up alarms to notify you

if resource creation and
deletion do not occur as planned.
I hope you enjoyed the video.

Check out the links
below for more resources.
Thanks for joining us.
